title: Building supplier SIG warns of hit to profits amid construction woes
text:
Building materials firm SIG has sold two divisions to help slash its £158m debt pile, and warned a construction slowdown across the UK and Germany will hit profits.

The company’s stock tumbled as much as 26pc to 88.4p following the trading update.

Activity in the UK construction sector declined at one of the fastest paces in the past decade last month, forcing firms to lay off staff as investment in new projects dried up.

SIG said the sector’s dismal performance means its full-year profits will be significantly lower than previously thought. Analysts are now expecting a £40m profit, down from previous predictions of £80m.

The firm is now preparing to sell off its air handling and building solutions...
